blog.name: elyvorg
blog.title: elyvorg's art and stuff
blog.description: A tumblr mostly full of my art and rambles about the various works of fiction I'm into. Includes Danganronpa V3 (containing many #danganronpa v3 spoilers), Digimon Savers (with only a handful of #digimon savers spoilers), Ace Attorney (particularly AAI2; beware #aai2 spoilers), probably some Pokémon, other stuff. Also features reblogs of art and other things relevant to my interests. For more details, check the about page. For even more DRV3, I have a sideblog featuring an ongoing lengthy commentary of the entire game.

summary: Time for another drawing for my old Pokémon fanfiction Foregone Conclusion? Apparently! I totally chose this scene because it’s...
caption:
Time for another drawing for my old Pokémon fanfiction Foregone Conclusion? Apparently!

I totally chose this scene because it’s the only scene set in a cave rather than a forest and therefore I wouldn’t have to draw any goddamn trees in the background. Yes. Definitely the only reason.

(Man, I wish I could show this to 2010-me. She’d flip out.)

reblog.comment:
Time for another drawing for my old Pokémon fanfiction Foregone Conclusion? Apparently!

I totally chose this scene because it’s the only scene set in a cave rather than a forest and therefore I wouldn’t have to draw any goddamn trees in the background. Yes. Definitely the only reason.

(Man, I wish I could show this to 2010-me. She’d flip out.)

trail.content_raw:
Time for another drawing for my old Pokémon fanfiction Foregone Conclusion? Apparently!

I totally chose this scene because it’s the only scene set in a cave rather than a forest and therefore I wouldn’t have to draw any goddamn trees in the background. Yes. Definitely the only reason.

(Man, I wish I could show this to 2010-me. She’d flip out.)
trail.content:
Time for another drawing for my old Pokémon fanfiction Foregone Conclusion? Apparently!

I totally chose this scene because it’s the only scene set in a cave rather than a forest and therefore I wouldn’t have to draw any goddamn trees in the background. Yes. Definitely the only reason.

(Man, I wish I could show this to 2010-me. She’d flip out.)

body:
Words, michaela, use your words

So there is a girl at my workplace who has sparked my interest and I want to be her friend now. Our first conversation:

Her: is that a pokemon shirt??

Me: yes

Her: lemme see it!

Me: <unzips my two vests to show my pokemon shirt that has only a pokeball on it>

Her: awesome!! Bulbasaur is my favorite starter pokemon. Squirtle is cool too, but bulbasaur is so chubby and cute!

Me: <wanting to infodump about pokemon but idk where to start so I just keep nodding my head and saying yes>

Her: <walks away to continue working>

Me: dang it <also now I somewhat obsessively watch her wishing I could start a conversation>

reblog.comment:
Words, michaela, use your words

Me: yes

Her: lemme see it!

Me:

Her: awesome!! Bulbasaur is my favorite starter pokemon. Squirtle is cool too, but bulbasaur is so chubby and cute!

Me:

Her:

Me: dang it

trail.content_raw:
Words, michaela, use your words

blog.name: pokemon-gold-demo
blog.title: The Beta Pokedex project
blog.description:
A blog dedicated to my art project of drawing official-looking illustrations for
all beta version Pokemon that were found from the Pokemon Gold Demo at Spaceworld 1997.

Reposting is ok! Just do NOT remove my signature or url from the images. If you want to use my artwork without the signature (for Youtube thumbnails for example), a link to this blog must be provided.

You can find me and my other work in: skudde.deviantart.com / skudde.tumblr.com / @skuddeouo on Twitter

summary: The betaBayleef is quite the challenge and I refuse to use the sprite pose, so I decided to force out another sketch. I’m liking...
caption:
The betaBayleef is quite the challenge and I refuse to use the sprite pose, so I decided to force out another sketch. I’m liking how dynamic the newer one looks~

Oh and sorry for the radio silence guys! This month is super busy for me so I haven’t had the time to sit down and work on art much.

title: Klink - 599
body:
The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

- Pokemon Black, Y, Alpha Sapphire

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Yamask and Cofagrigus
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Yamask and Cofagrigus
body:
562: Yamask

We all know how I feel about the Ghost type by now. So now that we’re in the favorite Generation, how do it handle its first Ghost type Pokemon?

Well, we first off have Yamask. A cute little shadow-critter with an adorably creepy face. Complete with having huge, red eyes shaped to look like it’s crying. Yes, a crying Ghost Type. You know the Pokedex entries are gonna be fun with this one.

So put that mask it carries on its tail in the equation and it all comes together finely. The golden mask is actually meant to be its former, human face. Before, Pokemon have always kind of dodged the idea that Ghost type Pokemon would be the spirits of human beings, or at the very least it just kind of left them with the idea that they would be supernatural, spectral beings. So it was strange to see this one not just leave an implication but just outright state that it’s a human ghost.

Personal Score: 8.5/10

Delightfully creepy and cute!

563: Cofagrigus

And if that wasn’t enough to creep you out, here we have Cofagrigus, a freaky shadowy figure that has evolved into an entire haunted sarcophagus. And it’s not the sad little crying ghost from before. Cofagrigus is pissed. And alongside its diet of gold, it’ll also grab intruders with its shadowy arms and drag them into itself, where it mummifies them alive and won’t let them out. Have YOU used one of these things? What’s to say it isn’t hiding a human corpse inside of itself and you just don’t know it. That’s some Five Nights at Freddy’s junk right there.

This even goes along with its ability, Mummy. All it does is replace the opponent’s ability with Mummy after you make contact with it. Which can cause some weird in-battle interactions if you effectively cancel out the right Pokemon’s ability. And it’s sure to be the source of some weird strategies where you get Mummy on an opponent’s Pokemon, and then switch to a Pokemon with an ability that hinders it like Regigigas or Slaking to just get rid of it entirely and go crazy from there. Obviously it’s not a super viable strategy, but one I like to think is fun anyways.

Personal Score: 9/10

Ghosts never disappoint, man. They never do!!

Overall:

A wonderful addition to the Halloween Monster collection. At last we have a mummy-mon!

[Archive]

reblog.comment:
[[MORE]]
